commit_message:
Limit hostfile generation to control nodes

With current implementation generation of hostfile is N^2, let's at
least limit this to controller nodes. Currently only RabbitMQ requires
hostnames, and these lands on control.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I15f8d98386ede8bbc89f66923f21547efe20ff37

commit_message:
Release OpenStack-Ansible Newton/14.0.0.0b3

Note that this release includes repositories which are still in
governance review:

 - ceph_client, haproxy_server
   https://review.openstack.org/358334

 - os_rally, os_sahara
   https://review.openstack.org/362897

Change-Id: I5b006feeaa16d017c83a57751f1bd1d830b0c54e

Both Nova and Docker uses POST in similiar cases

commit_message:
Use openjdk isntead of oracle jdk

We've used oracle jdk as a java runtime to run storlet java codes,
but it is not necesorry to use oracle jdk, and from some legal points
of view, it is better to use openjdk instead.

This patch makes changes to current scripts and files for installation,
to make them use openjdk.

NOTE:
Currently we add ppa:openjdk-r/ppa into apt repositoriy setting, but
we don't need that addition when we use Ubuntu 14.10 or later.

Closes-bug: #1618895
Change-Id: I4c65afd4edf6b0d8b5f5f83307a8129e67c2911d

commit_message:
Moving of Quotas scenarios into separate classes

This patch moving methods from Quotas' base classe into several independed classes
(by one on each method) with keeping of original names of scenarios.
Also this patch contains updated unit tests for all scenarios

Change-Id: I5e3fcf222e486878a4d3a3e077bcced30c357c9f

commit_message:
Update lxc_container_create role SHA

This change pulls in a fix to the galera log bind mount in
lxc_container_create.

Change-Id: Ia559a6c62bde5353d644428dc3d746d1b2b49f74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/93/363593/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | The fix for the broken bind mounts in the galera container (see `bug 1609862 <https://launchpad.net/bugs/1609862>` for details) will be applied to the LXC container configuration file, but a restart of each galera container is required to put the change into effect. Deployers can use the rolling restart functionality provided in the upgrade playbook within the main `OpenStack-Ansible repository <https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/stable/mitaka/scripts/upgrade-utilities/playbooks/galera-cluster-rolling-restart.yml>`_. Deployers can also shut down and power on galera containers **one at a time** manually if that method is preferred. This will also cause the old error logs in ``/var/log/mysql_logs`` in the container to become unavailable since the new bind mount is mounted on top of the existing logs directory within the container. If these logs are critical for a deployer to keep, the deployer should: #. Power off one Galera container #. Copy the logs from the container's filesystem to ``/openstack/log/{{ inventory_hostname }}`` on the host filesystem #. Power on the Galera container #. Repeat for the other Galera containers fixes: - | The bind mount for logs on the galera container was found to be broken in `bug 1609862 <https://launchpad.net/bugs/1609862>` and it has been fixed. **NOTE:** This fix is partially applied for existing OpenStack-Ansible deployments. See the upgrade section of the release notes for the work required to fully apply the fix.

commit_message:
Config logABug feature for Keystone api-ref

Currently, Keystone api-ref is not configured with logABug feature.
When users click "Report bug" button, it leads to
"bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals" which is default.
We should change it to "bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/"

Change-Id: I8d6fc4d2a6ab9d7f444a02cbc2f756fdaa3de264
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/74/363374/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Config logABug feature giturl = u'http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/api-ref/source' # source tree # html_context allows us to pass arbitrary values into the html template html_context = {"bug_tag": "api-ref", "giturl": giturl, "bug_project": "keystone"}

commit_message:
Fix identation in nova.image

Currently identation in nova.image and related tests
looks ugly and doesn't comply with common pep8 guidelines.
This commit fixes it and makes nova.image code more
beautiful. Also test fixtures were moved under the
test class because they are reauired only there and some
typos are fixed.

Change-Id: I8505fc37a5a029c6ef3cbcc950f212c8347677ea

commit_message:
Make api-ref bug link point to nova

The openstackdocstheme includes a bug reference link, which defaults
to openstack manuals. We want to update this to be a Nova bug instead.

This also cleans up the pre openstackdocstheme support code

Change-Id: Iace4619c37b04b1504a7051e9e5274b2a3b77c24

commit_message:
Glare simple DB

This commit adds in-memory testing DB for Glare.

Co-Authored-By: Kairat Kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/87/343787/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Simple Database API for all artifact types""" from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import timeutils import semantic_version import glance.common.glare.exception as glare_exc from glance.common import utils from glance.db.glare import api from glance.glare import locking LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) DATA = { 'artifacts': {}, 'locks': {} } error_map = [{"catch": KeyError, "raise": glare_exc.NotFound}] class SimpleAPI(api.BaseDBAPI): @utils.error_handler(error_map) def create(self, context, values): global DATA values['created_at'] = values['updated_at'] = timeutils.utcnow() artifact_id = values['id'] if artifact_id in DATA['artifacts']: raise glare_exc.BadRequest( "Artifact with id '%s' already exists" % artifact_id) values['_type'] = self.type DATA['artifacts'][artifact_id] = values return values @utils.error_handler(error_map) def update(self, context, artifact_id, values): global DATA af = DATA['artifacts'][artifact_id] af.update(values) if 'status' in values and values['status'] == self.cls.STATUS.ACTIVE: af['activated_at'] = timeutils.utcnow() af['updated_at'] = timeutils.utcnow() DATA['artifacts'][artifact_id] = af return af @utils.error_handler(error_map) def delete(self, context, artifact_id): global DATA del DATA['artifacts'][artifact_id] @utils.error_handler(error_map) def get(self, context, artifact_id): global DATA return DATA['artifacts'][artifact_id] @utils.error_handler(error_map) def list(self, context, filters, marker, limit, sort): global DATA afs = list(DATA['artifacts'].values()) filters.append(('_type', None, 'eq', None, self.type)) for field_name, key_name, op, field_type, value in filters: if field_name == 'tags': values = utils.split_filter_value_for_quotes(value) for af in afs[:]: if not set(values).issubset(af['tags']): afs.remove(af) elif field_name == 'tags-any': values = utils.split_filter_value_for_quotes(value) for af in afs[:]: for tag in values: if tag in af['tags']: break else: afs.remove(af) # filter by dict field elif key_name is not None: for af in afs[:]: if key_name not in af[field_name]: afs.remove(af) elif op == 'in': for val in value: if af[field_name][key_name] == val: break else: afs.remove(af) elif not utils.evaluate_filter_op( af[field_name][key_name], op, value): afs.remove(af) # filter by common field else: for af in afs[:]: if op == 'in': for val in value: if field_name == 'version': val = semantic_version.Version.coerce(val) af_version = semantic_version.Version.coerce( af[field_name]) if af_version == val: break elif af[field_name] == val: break else: afs.remove(af) else: if field_name == 'version': af_version = semantic_version.Version.coerce( af[field_name]) if not utils.evaluate_filter_op( af_version, op, semantic_version.Version.coerce(value)): afs.remove(af) else: if not utils.evaluate_filter_op( af[field_name], op, value): afs.remove(af) for key, dir, prop_type in sort: # sort by version if key == 'version': def version_cmp(af1, af2): if af1['version'] is None and af2['version'] is None: return 0 elif af1['version'] is None: return -1 elif af2['version'] is None: return 1 return semantic_version.compare( af1['version'], af2['version']) afs.sort(cmp=version_cmp, reverse=dir == 'desc') else: reverse = dir == 'desc' afs.sort(key=lambda x: x[key] or '', reverse=reverse) return afs class SimpleLockApi(locking.LockApiBase): def create_lock(self, context, lock_key): global DATA item_lock = DATA['locks'].get(lock_key) if item_lock: raise glare_exc.Conflict("Cannot lock an item with key %s. " "Lock already acquired by other " "request." % lock_key) # TODO(kairat) Log user data in the log so we can identify who # acquired the lock else: DATA['locks'][lock_key] = lock_key return lock_key def delete_lock(self, context, lock_id): global DATA item_lock = DATA['locks'][lock_id] if item_lock: del DATA['locks'][lock_id]

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kairat Kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darja Shakhray <dshakhray@mirantis.com>

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/58/330458/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from glance.api.glare.v1 import resource from glance.common import wsgi class API(wsgi.Router): """WSGI router for Glare v1 API requests.""" def __init__(self, mapper): glare_resource = resource.create_resource() reject_method_resource = wsgi.Resource(wsgi.RejectMethodController()) # ---schemas--- mapper.connect('/schemas', controller=glare_resource, action='list_types', conditions={'method': ['GET']}) mapper.connect('/schemas', controller=reject_method_resource, action='reject', allowed_methods='GET') mapper.connect('/schemas/{type_name}', controller=glare_resource, action='type_name_schema', conditions={'method': ['GET']}) mapper.connect('/schemas/{type_name}', controller=reject_method_resource, action='reject', allowed_methods='GET') # ---artifacts--- mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}', controller=glare_resource, action='list', conditions={'method': ['GET']}) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}', controller=glare_resource, action='create', conditions={'method': ['POST']}) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}', controller=reject_method_resource, action='reject', allowed_methods='GET, POST') mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}', controller=glare_resource, action='update', conditions={'method': ['PATCH']}) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}', controller=glare_resource, action='show', conditions={'method': ['GET']}, body_reject=True) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}', controller=glare_resource, action='delete', conditions={'method': ['DELETE']}, body_reject=True) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}', controller=reject_method_resource, action='reject', allowed_methods='GET, PATCH, DELETE') # ---tags--- mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/tags', controller=glare_resource, action='set_tags', conditions={'method': ['PUT']}) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/tags', controller=glare_resource, action='get_tags', conditions={'method': ['GET']}) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/tags', controller=glare_resource, action='delete_tags', conditions={'method': ['DELETE']}, body_reject=True) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/tags', controller=reject_method_resource, action='reject', allowed_methods='GET, PUT, DELETE') mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/' 'tags/{tag_value}', controller=glare_resource, action='add_tag', conditions={'method': ['PUT']}, body_reject=True) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/' 'tags/{tag_value}', controller=glare_resource, action='remove_tag', conditions={'method': ['DELETE']}, body_reject=True) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/' 'tags/{tag_value}', controller=reject_method_resource, action='reject', allowed_methods='PUT, DELETE') # ---blobs--- mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/{blob_name}', controller=glare_resource, action='download_blob', conditions={'method': ['GET']}, body_reject=True) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/{blob_name}', controller=glare_resource, action='upload_blob', conditions={'method': ['PUT']}) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/{blob_name}', controller=reject_method_resource, action='reject', allowed_methods='GET, PUT') # ---blob dicts--- mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/{blob_dict}/' '{blob_name}', controller=glare_resource, action='download_blob', conditions={'method': ['GET']}, body_reject=True) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/{blob_dict}/' '{blob_name}', controller=glare_resource, action='upload_blob', conditions={'method': ['PUT']}) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/{blob_dict}/' '{blob_name}', controller=reject_method_resource, action='reject', allowed_methods='GET, PUT') # ---members--- mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/members', controller=glare_resource, action='list_members', conditions={'method': ['GET']}, body_reject=True) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/members', controller=glare_resource, action='create_member', conditions={'method': ['POST']}) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/members', controller=reject_method_resource, action='reject', allowed_methods='GET, POST') mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/members/' '{member_id}', controller=glare_resource, action='show_member', conditions={'method': ['GET']}, body_reject=True) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/' 'members/{member_id}', controller=glare_resource, action='update_member', conditions={'method': ['PUT']}) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/' 'members/{member_id}', controller=glare_resource, action='delete_member', conditions={'method': ['DELETE']}, body_reject=True) mapper.connect('/artifacts/{type_name}/{artifact_id}/' 'members/{member_id}', controller=reject_method_resource, action='reject', allowed_methods='GET, PUT, DELETE') super(API, self).__init__(mapper)

added_lines:
# Copyright 2016 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """A middleware that turns exceptions into parsable string. Inspired by Cinder's and Heat't faultwrapper. """ import sys import traceback from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_utils import reflection import six import webob from glance.api.glare.v1 import resource from glance.common.glare import exception from glance.common import wsgi class Fault(object): def __init__(self, error): self.error = error @webob.dec.wsgify(RequestClass=wsgi.Request) def __call__(self, req): serializer = resource.ResponseSerializer() resp = webob.Response(request=req) default_webob_exc = webob.exc.HTTPInternalServerError() resp.status_code = self.error.get('code', default_webob_exc.code) serializer.default(resp, self.error) return resp class GlareFaultWrapperFilter(wsgi.Middleware): """Replace error body with something the client can parse.""" error_map = { 'BadRequest': webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest, 'Unauthorized': webob.exc.HTTPUnauthorized, 'Forbidden': webob.exc.HTTPForbidden, 'NotFound': webob.exc.HTTPNotFound, 'RequestTimeout': webob.exc.HTTPRequestTimeout, 'Conflict': webob.exc.HTTPConflict, 'Gone': webob.exc.HTTPGone, 'PreconditionFailed': webob.exc.HTTPPreconditionFailed, 'RequestEntityTooLarge': webob.exc.HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge, 'UnsupportedMediaType': webob.exc.HTTPUnsupportedMediaType, 'RequestRangeNotSatisfiable': webob.exc.HTTPRequestRangeNotSatisfiable, 'Locked': webob.exc.HTTPLocked, 'FailedDependency': webob.exc.HTTPFailedDependency } def _map_exception_to_error(self, class_exception): if class_exception == Exception: return webob.exc.HTTPInternalServerError if class_exception.__name__ not in self.error_map: return self._map_exception_to_error(class_exception.__base__) return self.error_map[class_exception.__name__] def _error(self, ex): trace = None traceback_marker = 'Traceback (most recent call last)' webob_exc = None ex_type = reflection.get_class_name(ex, fully_qualified=False) is_remote = ex_type.endswith('_Remote') if is_remote: ex_type = ex_type[:-len('_Remote')] full_message = six.text_type(ex) if '
' in full_message and is_remote: message, msg_trace = full_message.split('
', 1) elif traceback_marker in full_message: message, msg_trace = full_message.split(traceback_marker, 1) message = message.rstrip('
') msg_trace = traceback_marker + msg_trace else: msg_trace = 'None
' if sys.exc_info() != (None, None, None): msg_trace = traceback.format_exc() message = full_message if isinstance(ex, exception.GlareException): message = ex.message if cfg.CONF.debug and not trace: trace = msg_trace if not webob_exc: webob_exc = self._map_exception_to_error(ex.__class__) error = { 'code': webob_exc.code, 'title': webob_exc.title, 'explanation': webob_exc.explanation, 'error': { 'message': message, 'type': ex_type, 'traceback': trace, } } return error def process_request(self, req): try: return req.get_response(self.application) except Exception as exc: return req.get_response(Fault(self._error(exc)))

commit_message:
Add test to validate the error strings in test_expirer

Improve test_get_process_values_* methods in obj/test_expirer in the
form assertRaises(ValueError, x.get_process_values,{}/vals), to use
the assertRaises context form.  This improves understandability by
validateing the error strings in addition to the ValueError.

Related-Change: I3d12b79470d122b2114f9ee486b15d381f290f95

Change-Id: I1c66b8894cba8328d19cf99491a8ad18ded71078

commit_message:
Glare engine

This commit adds engine for glare that is
responsible for policy checks, notifications
and access control.

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kairat Kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>

related to bp glare-api

Change-Id: Ia353798a38bd6f9b863403fc8838a69031fabdf1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/56/330456/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import jsonpatch from oslo_log import log as logging from glance.common.glare import exception from glance.common.glare import policy from glance.glare.notification import Notifier from glance.i18n import _LE from glance.objects import registry as glare_registry LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class Engine(object): """Engine is responsible for executing different helper operations when processing incoming requests from Glare API. So for Glance developers it is like Domain Model layers unified into 1 Layer. Engine receives incoming data and does the following: - check basic policy permissions - requests artifact definition from registry - check access permission(ro, rw) - pass data to base artifact and receive response from that artifact - notify other users about executed operation. So each method in Glare Engine should follow the approach above. """ registry = glare_registry.ArtifactRegistry registry.register_all_artifacts() @classmethod def _check_read_write_access(cls, context, artifact): """Check if artifact can be modified by user :param context: user context :param artifact: artifact definition :raise Forbidden if access is not allowed """ if not context.is_admin and context.tenant != artifact.owner: raise exception.Forbidden() @classmethod def _check_read_only_access(cls, context, artifact): """Check if user has read only access to artifact :param context: user context :param artifact: artifact definition :raise Forbidden if access is not allowed """ private = artifact.visibility != 'public' if (private and not context.is_admin and context.tenant != artifact.owner): # TODO(kairat): check artifact sharing here raise exception.Forbidden() @classmethod def _get_artifact(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id, read_only=False): """Return artifact for users Return artifact for reading/modification by users. Check access permissions and policies for artifact. """ artifact_type = Engine.registry.get_artifact_type(type_name) # only artifact is available for class users af = artifact_type.get(context, artifact_id) if read_only: cls._check_read_only_access(context, af) else: cls._check_read_write_access(context, af) return af @classmethod def list_type_names(cls, context): """List all available artifact type names. :param context: user context :return: list of available artifact type names """ policy.enforce("artifact_type_list", {}, context) types = [] for name, type_list in cls.registry.obj_classes().items(): item = {type_list[0].get_type_name(): [type_class.VERSION for type_class in type_list]} types.append(item) return types @classmethod def create(cls, context, type_name, field_values): """Create new artifact in Glare""" policy.enforce("artifact_create", field_values, context) artifact_type = cls.registry.get_artifact_type(type_name) # check quota # TODO(kairat): need to define how to check quotas # do artifact create af = artifact_type.create(context, field_values) # notify about new artifact Notifier.notify(context, "create", af.to_notification()) # return artifact to the user return af.to_dict() @classmethod def update(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id, patch): af = cls._get_artifact(context, type_name, artifact_id) try: af_dict = af.to_dict() af_dict_patched = patch.apply(af_dict) diff = DictDiffer(af_dict_patched, af_dict) # we mustn't add or remove attributes from artifact if diff.added() or diff.removed(): msg = _LE( "Forbidden to add or remove attributes from artifact") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) # there is a special API for tags if 'tags' in diff.changed(): msg = _LE("Forbidden to modify artifact tags with PATCH " "request. Use special Tag API for that.") raise exception.BadRequest(msg) values = {key: af_dict_patched[key] for key in diff.changed()} except (jsonpatch.JsonPatchException, jsonpatch.JsonPointerException, KeyError) as e: raise exception.BadRequest(message=e.message) except TypeError as e: raise exception.BadRequest("Incorrect type of the element. " "Reason: %s" % str(e)) if len(values) > 1 and ('visibility' in values or 'status' in values): msg = _LE("You have to modify 'visibility' and 'status' in a " "separate request.") raise exception.BadRequest(msg) if not values: return af_dict elif 'visibility' in values: return cls._publish(context, af) elif 'status' in values: if values['status'] == af.STATUS.DEACTIVATED: return cls._deactivate(context, af) elif values['status'] == af.STATUS.ACTIVE: if af_dict['status'] == af.STATUS.DEACTIVATED: return cls._reactivate(context, af) else: return cls._activate(context, af) else: raise exception.InvalidStatusTransition( orig=af_dict['status'], new=values['status']) return cls._update_props(context, af, values) @classmethod def _update_props(cls, context, af, values): """Update artifact definition.""" action_name = "artifact_update" policy.enforce(action_name, {}, context) modified_af = af.update(context, af, values) Notifier.notify(context, action_name, modified_af.to_notification()) return modified_af.to_dict() @classmethod def get(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id): """Return artifact representation from artifact repo.""" policy.enforce("artifact_get", {}, context) af = cls._get_artifact(context, type_name, artifact_id, read_only=True) return af.to_dict() @classmethod def list(cls, context, type_name, filters, marker=None, limit=None, sort=None): """Return list of artifacts requested by user :param filters: list of requested filters :return: list of artifacts """ policy.enforce("artifact_list", {}, context) artifact_type = cls.registry.get_artifact_type(type_name) # return list to the user af_list = [af.to_dict() for af in artifact_type.list(context, filters, marker, limit, sort)] return af_list @classmethod def delete(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id): """Delete artifact from glare""" policy.enforce("artifact_delete", {}, context) af = cls._get_artifact(context, type_name, artifact_id) af.delete(context, af) Notifier.notify(context, "artifact_delete", af.to_notification()) @classmethod def _activate(cls, context, af): """Make artifact available for download by users""" action_name = "artifact_activate" policy.enforce(action_name, {}, context) modified_af = af.activate(context, af) Notifier.notify(context, action_name, modified_af.to_notification()) return modified_af.to_dict() @classmethod def _reactivate(cls, context, af): """Make artifact active again after deactivation""" action_name = "artifact_reactivate" policy.enforce(action_name, {}, context) modified_af = af.activate(context, af) Notifier.notify(context, action_name, modified_af.to_notification()) return modified_af.to_dict() @classmethod def _deactivate(cls, context, af): """Make artifact not available for download for simple users""" action_name = "artifact_activate" policy.enforce(action_name, {}, context) modified_af = af.deactivate(context, af) Notifier.notify(context, action_name, modified_af.to_notification()) return modified_af.to_dict() @classmethod def _publish(cls, context, af): """Make artifact visibility public""" action_name = "artifact_publish" policy.enforce(action_name, {}, context) modified_af = af.publish(context, af) Notifier.notify(context, action_name, modified_af.to_notification()) return modified_af.to_dict() @classmethod def upload_blob(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id, blob_name, fd): """Upload Artifact blob""" action_name = "artifact_upload" policy.enforce(action_name, {}, context) af = cls._get_artifact(context, type_name, artifact_id) modified_af = af.upload_blob(context, af, blob_name, fd) Notifier.notify(context, action_name, modified_af.to_notification()) return modified_af.to_dict() @classmethod def upload_blob_dict(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id, blob_dict, blob_name, fd): """Upload Artifact blob to dict""" action_name = "artifact_upload" policy.enforce(action_name, {}, context) af = cls._get_artifact(context, type_name, artifact_id) modified_af = af.upload_blob_dict(context, af, blob_dict, blob_name, fd) Notifier.notify(context, action_name, modified_af.to_notification()) return modified_af.to_dict() @classmethod def download_blob(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id, blob_name): """Download blob from artifact""" policy.enforce("artifact_download", {}, context) af = cls._get_artifact(context, type_name, artifact_id, read_only=True) return af.download_blob(context, af, blob_name) @classmethod def download_blob_dict(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id, blob_dict, blob_name): """Download blob from artifact""" policy.enforce("artifact_download", {}, context) af = cls._get_artifact(context, type_name, artifact_id, read_only=True) return af.download_blob_dict(context, af, blob_dict, blob_name) @classmethod def _do_artifact_tag_modify_action( cls, context, type_name, artifact_id, action_name, notification_event_name, *args, **kwargs): """Check permissions to Artifact and execute update for Artifact tags. Check permissions to Artifact, call appropriate modification method for ArtifactTags in BaseArtifact and return updated Artifact definition to the user. When update finished notify users about the change. """ policy_name = "artifact_tag_modify" policy.enforce(policy_name, {}, context) af = cls._get_artifact(context, type_name, artifact_id) action = getattr(af, action_name) af.tags = action(context, af, *args, **kwargs) Notifier.notify(context, notification_event_name, af.to_notification()) return {'tags': af.tags} @classmethod def add_tag(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id, tag_value): """Add user tag to Artifact""" return cls._do_artifact_tag_modify_action( context, type_name, artifact_id, "add_tag", "artifact_add_tag", tag_value) @classmethod def remove_tag(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id, tag_value): """Remove user tag from Artifact""" return cls._do_artifact_tag_modify_action( context, type_name, artifact_id, "remove_tag", "artifact_remove_tag", tag_value) @classmethod def get_tags(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id): """Return all specified user tags for Artifact""" policy.enforce("artifact_get", {}, context) af = cls._get_artifact(context, type_name, artifact_id, read_only=True) return {'tags': af.tags} @classmethod def set_tags(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id, tag_list): """Clean previous user tags and set new tag values""" return cls._do_artifact_tag_modify_action( context, type_name, artifact_id, "set_tags", "artifact_tag_list_set", tag_list) @classmethod def delete_tags(cls, context, type_name, artifact_id): """Delete all user-specified tags""" cls._do_artifact_tag_modify_action( context, type_name, artifact_id, "delete_tags", "artifact_tag_list_delete") @classmethod def add_member(cls, context, artifact_id, credentials): raise NotImplemented @classmethod def delete_member(cls, context, artifact_id, member_id): raise NotImplemented @classmethod def update_member(cls, context, artifact_id, member_id, **values): raise NotImplemented @classmethod def get_member(cls, context, artifact_id, member_id, **filters): raise NotImplemented @classmethod def list_members(cls, context, artifact_id, **filters): raise NotImplemented class DictDiffer(object): """ Calculate the difference between two dictionaries as: (1) items added (2) items removed (3) keys same in both but changed values (4) keys same in both and unchanged values """ def __init__(self, current_dict, past_dict): self.current_dict, self.past_dict = current_dict, past_dict self.current_keys, self.past_keys = [ set(d.keys()) for d in (current_dict, past_dict) ] self.intersect = self.current_keys.intersection(self.past_keys) def added(self): return self.current_keys - self.intersect def removed(self): return self.past_keys - self.intersect def changed(self): return set(o for o in self.intersect if self.past_dict[o] != self.current_dict[o]) def unchanged(self): return set(o for o in self.intersect if self.past_dict[o] == self.current_dict[o])

commit_message:
Glare base artifact type

This commit adds a definition of base artifact
type - the ancestor of all custom types.

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kairat Kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darja Shakhray <dshakhray@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Skripnick <sskripnick@mirantis.com>

related to bp glare-api

Change-Id: I843927a58c87d79b36a5707b8e515d11898d750a

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_versionedobjects import base from oslo_versionedobjects import fields import semantic_version import six from webob.multidict import MultiDict from glance.common.glare import exception from glance.common.glare import policy from glance.common.glare import store_api from glance.common import store_utils from glance.common import timeutils from glance.common import utils from glance.i18n import _, _LE from glance.objects import fields as glare_fields from glance.objects.fields import attribute from glance.objects.fields import BlobFieldType as BlobStatus from glance.objects import validators artifact_opts = [ cfg.BoolOpt('delayed_blob_delete', default=False, help=_("Defines if blob must be deleted immediately " "or just marked as deleted so it can be cleaned by some" "other tool in background.")) ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(artifact_opts) LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class classproperty(property): """Special decorator that creates class properties""" def __get__(self, cls, owner): return classmethod(self.fget).__get__(None, owner)() class BaseArtifact(base.VersionedObject): """BaseArtifact is a central place in Glare. It execute Glare business logic operations and checks in like: 1) Check if artifact satisfies all requirements and can be activated 2) Check that artifact is not deactivated and download blobs ... BaseArtifact interacts with database and saves/requesta artifact info from specified database API. Base Artifact is an abstract class so all concrete classes must be inherited from that class. Concrete classes must define custom fields in addition to BaseArtifact fields and db_api that must be used for interaction with database. """ OBJ_PROJECT_NAMESPACE = 'glare' STATUS = glare_fields.ArtifactStatusField fields = { 'id': attribute(fields.StringField, system=True, init_func=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()), validators=[validators.is_uuid]), 'name': attribute(fields.StringField, required_on_activate=False, validators=[validators.max_str_len(255)]), 'owner': attribute(fields.StringField, system=True, required_on_activate=False,), 'status': attribute(glare_fields.ArtifactStatusField, system=True, default=glare_fields.ArtifactStatusField.QUEUED), 'created_at': attribute(fields.DateTimeField, system=True, init_func=lambda: timeutils.utcnow(), filter_ops=glare_fields.FILTERS), 'updated_at': attribute(fields.DateTimeField, system=True, init_func=lambda: timeutils.utcnow(), filter_ops=glare_fields.FILTERS), 'description': attribute(fields.StringField, mutable=True, required_on_activate=False, default="", validators=[ validators.max_str_len(4096)], sortable=False, filter_ops=[]), 'tags': attribute(glare_fields.List, element_type=fields.String, mutable=True, required_on_activate=False, init_func=lambda: [], sortable=False, # NOTE tags are filtered without any operators filter_ops=[], validators=[validators.tag_validator]), 'metadata': attribute(glare_fields.Dict, element_type=fields.String, required_on_activate=False, init_func=lambda: {}, validators=[validators.metadata_key_value, validators.max_dict_size(255)], sortable=False, filter_ops=[glare_fields.FILTER_EQ, glare_fields.FILTER_NEQ]), 'visibility': attribute(fields.StringField, default='private', system=True, filter_ops=(glare_fields.FILTER_EQ,)), 'version': attribute(glare_fields.VersionField, required_on_activate=False, filter_ops=glare_fields.FILTERS) } @classmethod def is_blob(cls, field_name): """Helper to check that field is blob :param field_name: name of field :return: True if field is a blob, False otherwise """ return isinstance(cls.fields[field_name], glare_fields.BlobField) @classmethod def is_blob_dict(cls, field_name): """Helper to check that field is blob dict :param field_name: name of field :return: True if field is a blob dict, False otherwise """ return (isinstance(cls.fields[field_name], glare_fields.Dict) and cls.fields[field_name].element_type == glare_fields.BlobFieldType) @classmethod def _init_artifact(cls, context, values): """Initialize an empty versioned object with values Initialize vo object with default values and values specified by user. Also reset all changes for initialized object so user of the method can track own changes. :param context: user context :param values: values needs to be set :return: artifact with initialized values """ af = cls(context) # setup default values for all non specified attributes default_attrs = [] for attr in af.fields: if attr not in values: default_attrs.append(attr) if default_attrs: af.obj_set_defaults(*default_attrs) for name, value in values.items(): setattr(af, name, value) af.obj_reset_changes() return af @classmethod def get_type_name(cls): """Return type name that allows to find Artifact Type in Glare Type name allows to find Artifact Type definition in Glare registry so Engine can instantiate Artifacts. Artifact also becomes available with artifact type in Glare API. For example, when get_type_name returns 'my_artifact' then users can list artifacts by GET <host_name>/v1/artifacts/my_artifact. This type name is also used in glare configuration when turning on/off specific Artifact Types. :return: string that identifies current Artifact Type. """ raise NotImplementedError() _DB_API = None @classmethod def init_db_api(cls): """Provide initialized db api to interact with artifact database. To interact with database each artifact type must provide an api to execute db operations with artifacts. :return: subtype of glance.db.glare.api.BaseDBAPI """ raise NotImplementedError() @classproperty def db_api(cls): """Return current database API""" if cls._DB_API is None: cls._DB_API = cls.init_db_api() return cls._DB_API @classmethod def create(cls, context, values): """Create new Artifact in Glare repo :param context: user context :param values: Dict with specified artifact properties :return: definition of create Artifact """ # validate version version = values.get('version') if version is not None: cls._validate_version(context, values.get('name'), version) # TODO(delete): values['version'] = str(semantic_version.Version.coerce(version)) # validate that we are not specifying any system attribute and # that we do not upload blobs or add locations here for field_name in values: if cls.fields[field_name].system is True: raise exception.Forbidden("Cannot specify system property %s. " "It is not available for modifying " "by users" % field_name) if cls.is_blob(field_name) or cls.is_blob_dict(field_name): msg = (_LE("Cannot add blob %s as part of artifact create. " "Use upload blob functionality") % field_name) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) # specify default values for new artifact with init_func for field_name, field in cls.fields.items(): if field_name not in values and field.init_func is not None: values[field_name] = field.init_func() af = cls._init_artifact(context, values) af.owner = context.tenant af_vals = cls.db_api.create(context, af.to_dict()) return cls._init_artifact(context, af_vals) @classmethod def _validate_version(cls, context, name, version): if version and name is None: raise exception.BadRequest("Cannot set artifact version without " "name.") if version is not None and name is not None: filters = {'name': name, 'version': version} if context.tenant is not None: filters.update({'owner': context.tenant}) if len(cls.list(context, MultiDict(filters))) > 0: raise exception.BadRequest( "Artifact with this name and version is already exists " "for this owner.") @classmethod def _create_blob_from_location(cls, context, url): if not store_utils.validate_external_location(url): msg = (_LE("Location %s is invalid.") % url) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) size = store_api.get_blob_size(url, context=context) if size < 0: msg = (_LE("Invalid blob size %d.") % size) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) return {'url': url, 'size': size, 'checksum': None, 'external': True, 'status': 'active'} @classmethod def update(cls, context, af, values): """Update Artifact in Glare repo :param context: user Context :param af: current definition of Artifact in Glare :param values: list of changes for artifact :return: definition of updated Artifact """ # reset all changes of artifact to reuse them after update af.obj_reset_changes() # check if system values are not specified for field_name in values: if cls.fields[field_name].system is True: raise exception.Forbidden("Cannot specify system property %s. " "It is not available for modifying " "by users" % field_name) # apply values to the artifact # if all changes applied then update values in db. # in other case exception is raised. for key, value in six.iteritems(values): if cls.is_blob(key): blob = getattr(af, key) if blob is None and 'url' in values[key]: policy.enforce('artifact_set_location', {}, context) value = cls._create_blob_from_location( context, values[key]['url']) elif af.status == cls.STATUS.ACTIVE \ and not af.fields[key].mutable: msg = (_LE("Forbidden to change property '%s' after " "activation") % key) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) setattr(af, key, value) # validate version cls._validate_version(context, af.name, af.version) af.updated_at = timeutils.utcnow() updated_af = cls.db_api.update(context, af.id, af.obj_get_changes()) return cls._init_artifact(context, updated_af) @classmethod def get(cls, context, artifact_id): """Return Artifact from Glare repo :param context: user context :param artifact_id: id of requested Artifact :return: Artifact definition """ af = cls.db_api.get(context, artifact_id) if af['status'] == cls.STATUS.DELETED: raise exception.ArtifactNotFound( type_name=cls.get_type_name(), id=artifact_id) return cls._init_artifact(context, af) @classmethod def list(cls, context, filters=None, marker=None, limit=None, sort=None): """List all available Artifacts in Glare repo :param context: user context :param filters: filtering conditions to Artifact list :param marker: id of Artifact that identifies where Glare should start listing Artifacts. So all Artifacts before that Artifact in resulting list must be ignored. It is useful for Artifact pagination. :param limit: maximum number of Artifact items in list. :param sort: sorting preferences when requesting Artifact list. :return: list of Artifacts """ sort = sort or {'created_at': 'desc'} for key, direction in six.iteritems(sort): # check if field can be sorted if not cls.fields[key].sortable: raise exception.BadRequest("The field %s is not sortable" % key) if direction not in ['desc', 'asc']: msg = (_LE('Invalid sort direction: %s') % direction) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) if key == 'version': if 'name' not in filters: msg = _LE("Cannot sort artifacts by version " "without specifying the name.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) else: name_op, __ = utils.split_filter_op( filters.get('name')) if name_op != 'eq': msg = _LE("Only 'eq' operator is allowed for " "name when sorting by version.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) filters = filters or MultiDict() parsed_filters = MultiDict() for key, filter_value in six.iteritems(filters): if key == 'tags-any' or key == 'tags': if ':' in filter_value: msg = _LE("Tags are filtered without operator") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) parsed_filters.add(key, filter_value) else: op, val = utils.split_filter_op(filter_value) if key == 'version': if 'name' not in filters: msg = _LE("Cannot filter artifacts by version " "without specifying the name.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) elif len(filters.getall('name')) > 1: msg = _LE("Name must be specified only once when " "filtering by version.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) else: name_op, __ = utils.split_filter_op( filters.get('name')) if name_op != 'eq': msg = _LE("Only 'eq' operator is allowed for " "name when filtering by version.") LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) if '.' in key: left, _, right = key.partition('.') key = left val = {right: val} field_type = cls.fields.get(key, None) if field_type is None: msg = (_LE("Unable filter '%s'") % key) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) if op not in field_type.filters: msg = (_LE("Unsupported filter type '%s(key)'." "The following filters are supported " "%(filters)s") % { 'key': op, 'filters': str(field_type.filters)}) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) if isinstance(field_type, fields.BooleanField): if val.lower() == 'true': val = True elif val.lower() == 'false': val = False else: msg = (_LE("Invalid filter value '%s'") % val) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) if op == 'in': parsed_filter = [field_type.coerce(cls(), key, value) for value in utils.split_filter_value_for_quotes(val)] else: parsed_filter = field_type.coerce(cls(), key, val) parsed_filters.add(key, {'value': parsed_filter, 'op': op}) return [cls._init_artifact(context, af) for af in cls.db_api.list( context, parsed_filters, marker, limit, sort)] @classmethod def delete(cls, context, af): """Delete Artifact and all blobs from Glare. :param context: user context :param af: definition of artifact targeted to delete """ # marking all blobs as pending delete blobs = {} for name, field in six.iteritems(af.fields): if isinstance(field, glare_fields.BlobField): b = getattr(af, name) if b: if b['status'] == BlobStatus.PENDING_DELETE: msg = _('Blob %(name)s is already deleting ' 'for artifact %(id)s') % {'name': name, 'id': af.id} raise exception.Conflict(message=msg) else: b['status'] = BlobStatus.PENDING_DELETE blobs[name] = b if blobs: cls.db_api.update(context, af.id, blobs) # delete blobs one by one if not CONF.delayed_blob_delete: for name, blob in six.iteritems(blobs): try: store_api.delete_blob(blob['url'], context=context) cls.db_api.update(context, af.id, {name: None}) except exception.GlareException: # TODO(kairat) need to catch exceptions # here and orphan blobs pass # delete artifact itself cls.db_api.delete(context, af.id) @classmethod def activate(cls, context, af): """Activate Artifact and make it available for users :param context: User Context :param af: current Artifact definition in Glare :return: definition of activated Artifact """ for name, type_obj in six.iteritems(af.fields): if type_obj.required_on_activate and getattr(af, name) is None: msg = (_LE( "'%s' attribute must be set before activation") % name) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) cls.validate_activate(context, af) if af.status != cls.STATUS.QUEUED: raise exception.InvalidStatusTransition( orig=af.status, new=cls.STATUS.ACTIVE ) active_af = cls.db_api.update(context, af.id, {'status': cls.STATUS.ACTIVE}) return cls._init_artifact(context, active_af) @classmethod def reactivate(cls, context, af): """Make Artifact active after de-activation :param context: user context :param af: definition of de-activated Artifact :return: definition of active Artifact """ if af.status != cls.STATUS.DEACTIVATED: raise exception.InvalidStatusTransition( orig=af.status, new=cls.STATUS.ACTIVE ) af = cls.db_api.update(context, af.id, { 'status': cls.STATUS.ACTIVE}) return cls._init_artifact(context, af) @classmethod def deactivate(cls, context, af): """Deny Artifact downloading due to security concerns If user uploaded suspicious Artifact then Cloud Admins(or other users - it depends on policy configurations) can deny Artifact download by users by making Artifact de-activated. After additional investigation Artifact can be re-activated or deleted from Glare. :param context: user context :param af: Artifact definition in Glare :return: definition of de-activated Artifact """ if af.status != cls.STATUS.ACTIVE: raise exception.InvalidStatusTransition( orig=af.status, new=cls.STATUS.ACTIVE ) af = cls.db_api.update(context, af.id, {'status': cls.STATUS.DEACTIVATED}) return cls._init_artifact(context, af) @classmethod def publish(cls, context, af): """Make Artifact available for everyone :param context: user context :param af: definition of published Artifact :return: definition of active Artifact """ if af.status != cls.STATUS.ACTIVE: raise exception.InvalidStatusTransition( orig=af.status, new=cls.STATUS.ACTIVE ) af = cls.db_api.update(context, af.id, { 'visibility': 'public'}) return cls._init_artifact(context, af) @classmethod def upload_blob(cls, context, af, field_name, fd): """Upload binary object as artifact property :param context: user context :param af: current Artifact definition :param field_name: name of blob field :param fd: file descriptor that Glare uses to upload the file :return: updated Artifact definition in Glare """ cls.validate_upload(context, af, field_name, fd) if not cls.is_blob(field_name): msg = (_LE("%s is not a blob") % field_name) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) blob = {'url': None, 'metadata': None, 'size': None, 'checksum': None, 'status': BlobStatus.SAVING, 'external': False, 'id': None} setattr(af, field_name, blob) cls.db_api.update( context, af.id, {field_name: getattr(af, field_name)}) location_uri, size, checksum, metadata =\ store_api.save_blob_to_store(af.id, fd, context) blob.update({'url': location_uri, 'metadata': metadata, 'status': BlobStatus.ACTIVE, 'size': size, 'checksum': checksum, 'id': getattr(af, field_name)['id']}) setattr(af, field_name, blob) af = cls.db_api.update( context, af.id, {field_name: getattr(af, field_name)}) return cls._init_artifact(context, af) @classmethod def download_blob(cls, context, af, field_name): """Download binary data from Glare Artifact. :param context: user context :param af: Artifact definition in Glare repo :param field_name: name of blob field :return: file iterator for requested file """ if not cls.is_blob(field_name): msg = (_LE("%s is not a blob") % field_name) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) if af.status == cls.STATUS.DEACTIVATED and not context.is_admin: msg = (_LE("Only admin is allowed to download image data " "when it's deactivated")) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.Forbidden(message=msg) blob = getattr(af, field_name) if blob is None or blob['status'] != BlobStatus.ACTIVE: msg = (_LE("%s is not ready for download") % field_name) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) data, __ = store_api.load_from_store(uri=blob['url'], context=context) meta = {'size': blob['size'], 'checksum': blob['checksum']} return data, meta @classmethod def upload_blob_dict(cls, context, af, blob_dict, blob_name, fd): """Upload binary object as artifact property :param context: user context :param af: current Artifact definition :param blob_name: name of blob key in dict :param fd: file descriptor that Glare uses to upload the file :param blob_dict: name of blob dict field :return: updated Artifact definition in Glare """ cls.validate_upload(context, af, blob_dict, fd) if not cls.is_blob_dict(blob_dict): msg = (_LE("%s is not a blob dict") % blob_dict) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) blob = {'url': None, 'metadata': None, 'size': None, 'checksum': None, 'status': BlobStatus.SAVING, 'external': False, 'id': None} blob_dict_attr = getattr(af, blob_dict) blob_dict_attr[blob_name] = blob # FIXME(mfedosin): rewriting all dictionary is a bad idea cls.db_api.update( context, af.id, {blob_dict: blob_dict_attr}) location_uri, size, checksum, metadata =\ store_api.save_blob_to_store(af.id, fd, context) blob.update({'url': location_uri, 'metadata': metadata, 'status': BlobStatus.ACTIVE, 'size': size, 'checksum': checksum, 'id': getattr(af, blob_dict)[blob_name]['id']}) # FIXME(mfedosin): rewriting all dictionary is a bad idea af_values = cls.db_api.update( context, af.id, {blob_dict: blob_dict_attr}) return cls._init_artifact(context, af_values) @classmethod def download_blob_dict(cls, context, af, blob_dict, blob_name): """Download binary data from Glare Artifact. :param context: user context :param af: Artifact definition in Glare repo :param blob_name: name of blob key in dict :param blob_dict: name of blob dict field :return: file iterator for requested file """ if not cls.is_blob_dict(blob_dict): msg = (_LE("%s is not a blob dict") % blob_dict) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) if af.status == cls.STATUS.DEACTIVATED and not context.is_admin: msg = (_LE("Only admin is allowed to download image data " "when it's deactivated")) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.Forbidden(message=msg) try: blob = getattr(af, blob_dict)[blob_name] except KeyError: msg = (_LE("Blob with name %(blob_name)s is not found in blob " "dictionary %(blob_dict)s") % (blob_name, blob_dict)) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.NotFound(message=msg) if blob is None or blob['status'] != BlobStatus.ACTIVE: msg = (_LE("Blob %(blob_name)s from blob dictionary %(blob_dict)s " "is not ready for download") % (blob_name, blob_dict)) LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadRequest(message=msg) data, __ = store_api.load_from_store(uri=blob['url'], context=context) meta = {'size': blob['size'], 'checksum': blob['checksum']} return data, meta @classmethod def add_tag(cls, context, af, tag_value): tags = af.tags tags.append(tag_value) af.tags = tags return cls.db_api.add_tag(context, af.id, tag_value) @classmethod def remove_tag(cls, context, af, tag_value): try: af.tags.remove(tag_value) except ValueError: raise exception.BadRequest( "Artifact doesn't have tag '%s'" % tag_value) return cls.db_api.remove_tag(context, af.id, tag_value) @classmethod def get_tags(cls, context, af): return cls.db_api.get_tags(context, af.id) @classmethod def set_tags(cls, context, af, tags_list): af.tags = tags_list return cls.db_api.set_tags(context, af.id, tags_list) @classmethod def delete_tags(cls, context, af): af.tags = [] return cls.db_api.delete_tags(context, af.id) @classmethod def add_member(cls, context, artifact_id, credentials): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def delete_member(cls, context, artifact_id, member_id): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def update_member(cls, context, artifact_id, member_id, **values): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def get_member(cls, context, artifact_id, member_id, **filters): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def list_members(cls, context, artifact_id, **filters): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def validate_activate(cls, context, af, values=None): pass @classmethod def validate_upload(cls, context, af, field_name, fd): pass def to_notification(self): """Return notification body that can be send to listeners :return: dict with notification information """ return { 'id': self.id, 'name': self.name, 'status': self.status, 'created_at': self.created_at, 'updated_at': self.updated_at, 'owner': self.owner, 'version': self.version # TODO(kairat) add other fields, # do we need possibility to pass custom fields } def to_dict(self): """Convert oslo versioned object to dictionary :return: dict with field names and field values """ return self.obj_to_primitive()['versioned_object.data']

commit_message:
Glare artifact types infrastructure

This commit adds necessary infrastructure
to enable creation of custom artifact types.

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kairat Kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darja Shakhray <dshakhray@mirantis.com>

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import six from oslo_log import log as logging from glance.i18n import _ LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class GlareException(Exception): """ Base Glare Exception To correctly use this class, inherit from it and define a 'message' property. That message will get printf'd with the keyword arguments provided to the constructor. """ message = _("An unknown exception occurred") def __init__(self, message=None, **kwargs): if message: self.message = message if kwargs: self.message = self.message % kwargs super(GlareException, self).__init__(self.message) def __unicode__(self): return six.text_type(self.message) class BadRequest(GlareException): message = _("Bad request") class InvalidStatusTransition(BadRequest): message = _("Transition status from %(orig)s to %(new)s was not valid") class Unauthorized(GlareException): message = _('You are not authenticated') class Forbidden(GlareException): message = _("You are not authorized to complete this action.") class NotFound(GlareException): message = _("An object with the specified identifier was not found.") class TypeNotFound(NotFound): message = _("Glare type with name '%(name)s' was not found.") class ArtifactNotFound(NotFound): message = _("Artifact with type name '%(type_name)s' and id '%(id)s' was " "not found.") class RequestTimeout(GlareException): message = _("The client did not produce a request within the time " "that the server was prepared to wait.") class Conflict(GlareException): message = _("The request could not be completed due to a conflict " "with the current state of the resource.") class Gone(GlareException): message = _("The requested resource is no longer available at the " "server and no forwarding address is known.") class PreconditionFailed(GlareException): message = _("The precondition given in one or more of the request-header " "fields evaluated to false when it was tested on the server.") class RequestEntityTooLarge(GlareException): message = _("The server is refusing to process a request because the " "request entity is larger than the server is willing or " "able to process.") class RequestRangeNotSatisfiable(GlareException): message = _("The request included a Range request-header field, and none " "of the range-specifier values in this field overlap the " "current extent of the selected resource, and the request " "did not include an If-Range request-header field.") class Locked(GlareException): message = _('The resource is locked.') class FailedDependency(GlareException): message = _('The method could not be performed because the requested ' 'action depended on another action and that action failed.')

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Common database interface for all objects""" class BaseDBAPI(object): def __init__(self, cls): self.type = cls.get_type_name() def create(self, context, values): """Create new artifact in db and return dict of values to the user :param context: user context :param values: dict of values that needs to be saved to db :return: dict of created values """ raise NotImplementedError() def update(self, context, artifact_id, values): """Update artifact values in database :param artifact_id: id of artifact that needs to be updated :param context: user context :param values: values that needs to be updated :return: dict of updated artifact values """ raise NotImplementedError() def get(self, context, artifact_id): """Return artifact values from database :param context: user context :param artifact_id: id of the artifact :return: dict of artifact values """ raise NotImplementedError() def delete(self, context, artifact_id): """Delete artifacts from db :param context: user context :param artifact_id: id of artifact that needs to be deleted :return: dict for deleted artifact value """ raise NotImplementedError() def list(self, context, filters, marker, limit, sort): """List artifacts from db :param context: user request context :param filters: filter conditions from url :param marker: id of first artifact where we need to start artifact lookup :param limit: max number of items in list :param sort: sort conditions :return: list of artifacts. Each artifact is represented as dict of values. """ raise NotImplementedError() def create_member(self, context, values, member_id): raise NotImplementedError() def update_member(self, context, artifact_id, member_id, values): raise NotImplementedError() def get_member(self, context, artifact_id, member_id): raise NotImplementedError() def delete_member(self, context, artifact_id, member_id): raise NotImplementedError() def list_members(self, context, artifact_id, filters, marker, limit, sort): raise NotImplementedError()

a Glance priority in Newton Cycle.

commit_message:
Update Glare API spec

This commit adds two small changes in Glare API:
1. For setting custom locations we're going to use
   our own content type
   'application/glare-external-location' instead of
   'application/json'.
2. 'content-type' is a required property for all blobs.

Change-Id: I2263b52932b7f23b46afe42f68589e2a0833bcee

commit_message:
[WIP] [Glare] Ensure locations cannot exceed max size

Check that we create a record for blob before creating locations.
Check that external locations don't exceed max size.

Change-Id: Ied231e2f3f1f9b96474db0944ef0bd6c28ac3e30

added_lines: def get(self, url, status=200, headers=None): return self._check_artifact_method("get", url, status=status, headers=headers) def test_microversions(self): url = '/sample_artifact' # test default microversions self.get(url=url, status=200) # corrected microversions headers = {'OpenStack-API-Version': 'artifact 1.0'} self.get(url=url, status=200, headers=headers) # microversions values outside tolerance # headers = {'OpenStack-API-Version': 'artifact 0.1'} # self.get(url=url, status=400, headers=headers) headers = {'OpenStack-API-Version': 'artifact 2.0'} self.get(url=url, status=406, headers=headers) # uncorrected value of microversions headers = {'OpenStack-API-Version': 'artifact 1'} self.get(url=url, status=400, headers=headers) headers = {'OpenStack-API-Version': 'artifact lalala'} self.get(url=url, status=400, headers=headers) # uncorrected value of service # (using values microversions of default) headers = {'OpenStack-API-Version': 'non_existent_service 1.0'} self.get(url=url, status=200, headers=headers)

commit_message:
Refresh puppet module symlinks after every package update

This adds create_openstack_puppet_modules_symlinks function and calls it
after each package update, to ensure that newly installed modules can be
found by Puppet.

Suggestion that the symlinks should be handled by OPM packaging received
pushback that such solution doesn't fit all use cases for the OPM
package.

A somewhat specific issue are the scripts for nodes which don't execute
the upgrade right away from Heat, but only write out a script for later
execution. There we need to pass along the function definition of
create_openstack_puppet_modules_symlinks using `declare -f`. (Using
deployment artifacts for something like this could collide with the
user-specific use cases for deployment artifact parameters.)

Closes-Bug: #1613211
Change-Id: I60201b45e4f8d823f4e216503fb218fd8e36d73c

'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2016-03-31 14:44:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/8ec033bdc2b998b3f77a46589f3807077ba5f566', 'message': "[WIP] Glare

Glare (aka Glance Artifact Repository) is a new service which
is marketed as an improved Glance.

Glare offers its users a number of important features, like:
 * Custom assets — it's not just images anymore, but also Heat
   templates, Murano packages, Mistral workbooks, Tacker
   blueprints and so on.
 * Artifacts versioning — each artifact can be supplemented
   with the version in SemVer format.
 * Support of multiple binary objects per artifact — currently
   an image contains only one binary attribute - ‘file’. From
   Glare’s part, it allows you to specify a set of such attributes.
 * Structured properties — artifacts may contain structured
   properties like ‘dict’, ‘list’ and 'set'.
 * Dependencies between artifacts — one artifact may depend on
   the other.
 * Additional filtering for artifacts with various operators.
 * Importing/exporting of artifacts between clouds.

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kairat Kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darja Shakhray <dshakhray@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I5e3319e92dbf7877df8db5a4a64aac9490196f2d

   an image contains only one binary attribute - ‘file’. From
   Glare’s part, it allows you to specify a set of such attributes.
 * Structured properties — artifacts may contain structured
   properties like ‘dict’, ‘list’ and 'set'.
 * Dependencies between artifacts — one artifact may depend on
   the other.
 * Additional filtering for artifacts with various operators.
 * Importing/exporting of artifacts between clouds.

commit_message:
Glare

Glare (from GLance Artifact REpository) is a service that
provides access to a unified catalog of structured
meta-information as well as related binary data
(these structures are also called 'artifacts').

Glare offers its users a number of important features, like:
 * Custom assets — it's not just images anymore, but also Heat
   templates, Murano packages, Mistral workbooks, Tacker
   blueprints and so on.
 * Artifacts versioning — each artifact can be supplemented
   with the version in SemVer format.
 * Support of multiple binary objects per artifact. From
   Glare’s part, it allows to specify a set of such attributes.
 * Structured properties — artifacts may contain structured
   properties like ‘dict’ and ‘list’.
 * Dependencies between artifacts — one artifact may depend on
   the other.
 * Additional filtering for artifacts with various operators.
 * Importing/exporting of artifacts between clouds.

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kairat Kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darja Shakhray <dshakhray@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I5e3319e92dbf7877df8db5a4a64aac9490196f2d

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_versionedobjects import base from glance.common.glare import exception class BaseArtifact(base.VersionedObject): """Artifact class is responsible for creating/updating/requesting/deleting and executing other operations in Glare. All custom artifact types should be inherited from this class. """ OBJ_PROJECT_NAMESPACE = 'glare' @classmethod def get_type_name(cls): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def create(cls, context, values): af = cls(context=context, **values) cls._save_to_db(context, af.obj_to_primitive()['versioned_object.data']) return af @classmethod def update(cls, context, artifact_id, values): af = cls._save_to_db(context, values, artifact_id) return cls(context=context, **af) @classmethod def get(cls, context, artifact_id): af = cls._get_from_db(context, artifact_id) return cls(context=context, **af) @classmethod def list(cls, context, filters, marker, limit, sort): return [cls(context=context, **af) for af in cls._get_all_from_db( context, filters, marker, limit, sort)] @classmethod def delete(cls, context, artifact_id): cls._delete_from_db(context, artifact_id) @classmethod def activate(cls, context, artifact_id): af = cls._get_from_db(context, artifact_id) if af['status'] != 'queued': raise exception.InvalidStatusTransition( orig=af['status'], new='active' ) af = cls._save_to_db(context, {'status': 'active'}, artifact_id) return cls(context=context, ** af) @classmethod def reactivate(cls, context, artifact_id): af = cls._get_from_db(context, artifact_id) if af['status'] != 'deactivated': raise exception.InvalidStatusTransition( orig=af['status'], new='active' ) af = cls._save_to_db(context, {'status': 'active'}, artifact_id) return cls(context=context, **af) @classmethod def deactivate(cls, context, artifact_id): af = cls._get_from_db(context, artifact_id) if af['status'] != 'active': raise exception.InvalidStatusTransition( orig=af['status'], new='active' ) af = cls._save_to_db(context, {'status': 'deactivated'}, artifact_id) return cls(context=context, **af) @classmethod def upload_blob(cls, context, artifact_id, field_name, fd, *args, **kwargs): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def download_blob(cls, context, artifact_id, field_name, *args, **kwargs): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def delete_blob(cls, context, artifact_id, field_name, *args, **kwargs): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def add_member(cls, context, artifact_id, credentials): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def delete_member(cls, context, artifact_id, member_id): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def update_member(cls, context, artifact_id, member_id, **values): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def get_member(cls, context, artifact_id, member_id, **filters): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def list_members(cls, context, artifact_id, **filters): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def validate_activate(cls, context, artifact_id, values=None): return True @classmethod def _save_to_db(cls, context, values, artifact_id=None): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def _get_from_db(cls, context, artifact_id): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def _delete_from_db(cls, context, artifact_id): raise NotImplementedError() @classmethod def _get_all_from_db(cls, context, filters, marker, limit, sort): raise NotImplemented()

subject: Fix metadata agent config when using SSL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-26 14:06:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/metadata/config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/36b1052e8850ca0d10665d1966dc7325ad936d20', 'message': "Fix metadata agent config when using SSL

The metadata agent (neutron-metadata-agent) is receiving requests from
metadata proxies in namespaces (neutron-ns-metadata-proxy) through a
UNIX socket. The requests there are always plain HTTP and since it's not
going through the network, it's fine.

However, if [DEFAULT] use_ssl in neutron.conf is set to true, then
neutron-metadata-agent inherits this and expects HTTPS on this UNIX
socket too. So always override this setting.

Change-Id: I3b3ed56fd318e10d4a5668c86e36a4c0f87c5cc5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix metadata agent config when using SSL

The metadata agent (neutron-metadata-agent) is receiving requests from
metadata proxies in namespaces (neutron-ns-metadata-proxy) through a
UNIX socket. The requests there are always plain HTTP and since it's not
going through the network, it's fine.

However, if [DEFAULT] use_ssl in neutron.conf is set to true, then
neutron-metadata-agent inherits this and expects HTTPS on this UNIX
socket too. So always override this setting.

Change-Id: I3b3ed56fd318e10d4a5668c86e36a4c0f87c5cc5

commit_message:
Don't use config option sqlite_db

Config option sqlite_db is deprecated in
0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2, and
deprecate argument sqlite_db in method set_defaults in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/350945/, should use
config option connection instead.

Change-Id: If21c6bbdd83c31a27c73182160038115106c87df

commit_message:
Cinder get-capabilities tests

Cinder allows getting capabilities for a storage back end

Added:
- Api for get-capabilities
- Documentation reference for cinder show_pools

Tests:
- Test get capabilities for a given back end
- Test get volume stats
Note: Only admin has the privileges to perform get-capabilities action,
by default.

Change-Id: I1329a1339e1d8526f94ee57fb0ab43a78d881174

Fix for correct work of disabling mos-updates|security repos

Fix for correct work of disabling mos-updates|security repos if
PATCHING_DISABLE_UPDATES=True for fuel-qa/master branch

Change-Id: Ie39caa26d93c49fcf78a134253dddb125acf621c

commit_message:
Do not create sahara templates anymore

This patch removes creation of sahara templates during Sahara
installation, as it doesn't have any end-user benefits.

Also Sahara templates relies that all Nova flavor already created,
but since I80b63ce1ebca01be61ac0f43d26a2992ecf16678 Nova flavors
will not be automatically created.

Change-Id: Ic32f8f1a9112804bfbf847855e13510e504cc6b5
Closes-bug: #1603939

commit_message:
Remove vpn service plugin stevedore aliases

The service plugin is maintained in a separate neutron-vpnaas repo, and
hence its aliases should be maintained there too.

The patch that introduces those aliases in neutron-vpnaas repo is:
Ieb4e9fce9f5cf9b5a60f1207ec38a59adfe400a8

Change-Id: I86b5b554ed9995a0d4538fb968526b370cad036b

commit_message:
Fix restore exception handling

Re-raise exception in restore so that higher
level excption handling can occur. Specifically
rich_queue needs to be closed when an exception
is encountered.

Fixes Bug: #1609094

Change-Id: Ib4d71f85b0c1f14bdd8980b35f23f351df176763
(cherry picked from commit 819a5c14e81db9ae4c7319ef71d0e9a9d312c599)

commit_message:
RequestAddress when subnet has not been created

gw_address is received in IpamDriver.RequestAddress when create network.
In Docker 1.12+, it will have NETWORK_GATEWAY_OPTIONS, but in lower
docker version, such as 1.9.1, it will not carry this option.
This change check if subnet exist first, this makes it can work for both
docker version.

Change-Id: I1c741172e927179f83284e8a23afce5f07b130f9
Closes-bug: #1611261

TrivialFix: Remove logging import unused

This patch removes logging import unused in
os_brick/initiator/initiator_connector.py

[--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--detail] [--goal <goal>] [--strategy <strategy>]``--goal <goal>`` UUID or name of the goal used for filtering. ``--strategy <strategy>`` UUID or name of the strategy used for filtering. Operation: 'add', 'replace', or 'remove'... _watcher_scoringengine_list: watcher scoringengine list -------------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: watcher scoringengine list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--detail] [--limit <limit>] [--sort-key <field>] [--sort-dir <direction>] List information on retrieved scoring engines. **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--detail`` Show detailed information about scoring engines. ``--limit <limit>`` Maximum number of actions to return per request, 0 for no limit.
